thread.section_title: Texas Longhorns News - Sports News for Dallas, Texas
thread.title: Texas Quotable: 'It's our fault we're in the position we're in'
thread.title_full: Texas Quotable: 'It's our fault we're in the position we're in' | Dallas Morning News

author: Nick Castillo
title: Texas Quotable: 'It's our fault we're in the position we're in'
text:
Texas head coach Charlie Strong said it's the Longhorns fault for their 1-3 record, the worst start since 1956.
"It's our own fault that we've been in the position we're in, " Strong said. "We have to learn how to just go close out games. Everybody has a job to do, and just do your job and just keep battling, keep competing."
Strong on his message to the team
"I said to them after the game, I said, if you think about us, guys, you look at the two opponents we've played the last two weeks and look where we are and just how far we've come; it's our own fault that we've been in the position we're in. We have to learn how to just go close out games. Everybody has a job to do, and just do your job and just keep battling, keep competing."
Strong on if he feels unlucky
"I don't always [feel unlucky] - but you know what, a lot of times we've got to create our own, and we've got to create plays. You look at it, you look at that game there on Saturday, and we have our chances. We don't have a dropped ball here and then just them making a stop, we take the will out of them to take the ball ... we had our opportunities."
Strong on the upcoming game against TCU
"It's going to be a big challenge this week. TCU is a very good football team. I think they're No. 3 or No. 4 in the polls. The thing we're going to have to do is just go out this week and make sure the preparation -- we have to be on point because in order for us to go forward and play an unbelievable game. We're going to have to start -- has to start tomorrow."
Senior wide receiver Marcus Johnson on the team's mentality
"It's too early to give up So we have to continue to know that these last two games, the difference in points, and the record we have now ... it's still not what is should be and we can't make excuses for it. And we have to find a way to turn it around."
Johnson on the message sent at Texas' players-only meeting
At some point, we have to make up our minds that those three point losses and the little things throughout the game, we have to stand up and say 'we need to make the difference. [The coaches] are putting us in the right position. They're making the right play calls. We just have to capitalize as players.
Senior offensive guard Sedrick Flowers on if the team can hang with TCU
I think we're capable of hanging with any team. Our offense when we get going we're putting points up ... Our defense is coming around. We saw how they did in this past game. I feel like when we play on all cylinders we can compete with any team.
Texas coach Charlie Strong: "It's our fault we're in the position we're in." Not biting on officiating question.
— Chuck Carlton (@ChuckCarltonDMN) September 28, 2015
Texas opened as an 18.5-point underdog at TCU this Saturday (via http://t.co/n45oSO9iJz ). Now. 17.5.
— Chuck Carlton (@ChuckCarltonDMN) September 28, 2015
Charlie Strong says concern with attitude after two hard losses is the veterans, not the young players.
— Chuck Carlton (@ChuckCarltonDMN) September 28, 2015
Charlie Strong on TCU offense and WR Josh Doctson: "We know the ball is going to go to Doctson."
— Chuck Carlton (@ChuckCarltonDMN) September 28, 2015
Charlie Strong says he doesn't remember what we said to the official on penalty.: "I forgot what it was." Laughter ensues.
— Chuck Carlton (@ChuckCarltonDMN) September 28, 2015
Charlie Strong says OL Kent Perkins is day-to-day. Offense ground to a halt without him in second half.
— Chuck Carlton (@ChuckCarltonDMN) September 28, 2015
Charlie Strong on his penalty: "The lesson is I just have to stay under control. ... I cant lose my composure."
— Chuck Carlton (@ChuckCarltonDMN) September 28, 2015
Strong when asked if he had ever been in a game with so many one-sided iffy calls: "No, I haven't." But says team must be more disciplined.
— Chuck Carlton (@ChuckCarltonDMN) September 28, 2015
Strong on Jerrod Heard mistakes Saturday: "More than anything, he held the ball too long."
— Chuck Carlton (@ChuckCarltonDMN) September 28, 2015
Strong gets question on state of program with first 1-3 start since 1956. Praises Texas fans. "We have to give them something to watch."
— Chuck Carlton (@ChuckCarltonDMN) September 28, 2015
Charlie Strong on point spread against TCU: "I didn't know it was that bad. Wow."
